image.altText: Shane Drumgold out the front of the ACT courts.

props.synopsis: The ACT's former top prosecutor Shane Drumgold has succeeded in challenging some findings made against him in an inquiry into the prosecution of former Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann.

title.children: Former top prosecutor successfully challenges inquiry findings into Bruce Lehrmann prosecution

image.altText: Mohammad Qazzaz at his coffee roastery with a Palestinian keffiyeh around his shoulders

props.synopsis: Arab American votes were once all but guaranteed for Democrats, but now in the swinging state of Michigan where every vote counts, that once faithful voter bloc is shrinking — and furious.

title.children: This group of voters could decide who next takes the White House — and they're furious

image.altText: Peter Dutton speaks in a courtyard at Parliament House

props.synopsis: The relief among Labor MPs and officials was palpable, but the celebratory speeches at the Liberal Party function did appear incongruous with the stark reality of an election loss, writes Patricia Karvelas.

title.children: The stark reality is Dutton's 'working-class' strategy wasn't a hit with voters

image.altText: Farmer Wendy Whelan stands in a paddock, with cows, trees and hills in the background.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of businesses and farms were hit by a summer of storms, floods, and fires. But community leaders say Victoria's disaster response systems are "a mystery" as recovery funding fails to reach them.

title.children: Uninsured home owners eligible for emergency relief while farm businesses say they 'get nothing'

image.altText: A woman sits on a park bench

props.synopsis: Professional basketballer Alex Bunton didn't know that what she was experiencing was abuse and struggled to reach out for help. New data shows many who find themselves in similar situations never escape.

title.children: Pro basketballer's domestic abuse started with love-bombing and financial control before it turned physical

image.altText: A male golfer celebrates cheering in front of a large group of fans

props.synopsis: One talented child in a family is exceptional. Two is extraordinary. Siblings Minjee and Min Woo Lee are both big stars on the golf circuit … but they couldn’t be more different.

title.children: Part-time golfer, full-time 'cook': How an Aussie sportsman has reached cult status

image.altText: Linda Reynolds looks into the distance

props.synopsis: Senator Linda Reynolds receives a settlement and apology from the ACT government over a letter former director of public prosecutions Shane Drumgold penned to the Australian Federal Police after Bruce Lehrmann's trial.

title.children: Linda Reynolds gets $90k payout from ACT government over Bruce Lehrmann prosecutor's comments

image.altText: A man holding a bunch of bananas and a banh mi.

props.synopsis: Australians are losing nearly a billion dollars a year in card surcharges, which could be substantially reduced when a system called least-cost routing is fully implemented.

title.children: Australians lose nearly $1 billion a year to card surcharges as RBA warns banks to stop

image.altText: A composite image of Brisbane Broncos' Ezra Mam and Sydney Roosters' Spencer Leniu during their NRL season opener in Las Vegas.

props.synopsis: As the NRL investigates an allegation of a racial slur in the marquee game of the NRL Las Vegas showpiece, Brisbane Broncos coach Kevin Walters says his five-eighth was upset in the rooms after the match and "adamant" Spencer Leniu racially abused him.

title.children: Broncos and Roosters clash in Vegas hotel after allegation of racial abuse in NRL season opener

image.altText: A smashed car at the bottom of a steep set of stairs

props.synopsis: The driver, believed to be in his 70s, was conscious when ambulance paramedics arrived and he was treated at the scene.

title.children: 'It's a miracle he's alive': CCTV captures moment driver car plunges down 15-metre wall in Sydney

image.altText: A serious woman standing next to a fallen limb from a large tree, which is to her right.

props.synopsis: The 2023 Victorian Tree of the Year has lost massive limbs in what sounded like "a car crash". A Dja Dja Wurrung elder is urging greater protection of the significant river red gum.

title.children: Future of majestic river red gum tree in central Victoria uncertain after massive limbs lost

image.altText: Natasha Stott Despoja speaks to the media.

props.synopsis: Former senator Natasha Stott Despoja has been appointed to head South Australia's Royal Commission into Domestic, Family and Sexual Violence.

title.children: Natasha Stott Despoja to lead SA's domestic violence royal commission

image.altText: Taken through window shutters, a person is arrested on a suburban street by many police officers

props.synopsis: A man dies and a woman is rushed to hospital after police earlier warned residents of a knife wielding man in the Perth suburb of Greenwood.

title.children: Elderly man dead, woman in hospital following knife incident in Perth suburb

image.altText: A man sits at a desk.

props.synopsis: ASIC is alleging Dave Hodgson and two of his companies provided unlicensed financial services and made misrepresentations to investors. Mr Hodgson, who is the proponent behind what he claims would be a "clean" coal-to-hydrogen project in Tasmania says he will "mount a very strong defence".

title.children: 'They crucified Jesus, now us': Supporters rally around businessman being sued by ASIC

image.altText: Giant screen on the wall of the ASX, with large green numbers, showing the price of shares which have risen.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market is trading lower at lunchtime, led by losses in utilities and health care. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX trading lower, job ads down in February

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Petrol prices climb, with the NT still the most expensive place to fill up at the bowser
KPMG resigns as Downer EDI's auditor
ASX tracking slightly lower at lunch

image.altText: Eden Golan singing into a microphone in front of a stage. She's wearing a black jumpsuit with a long skirt

props.synopsis: The competition's organisers have taken issue with verses appearing to reference the Hamas terrorist attack on Israel on October 7. The song, originally called October Rain, will be renamed Hurricane.

title.children: Israel agrees to change Eurovision song lyrics amid concern words reference Gaza war

image.altText: A smiling blonde woman showing her teeth in front of a row of motorbikes in Bali.

props.synopsis: Thousands of Australians are travelling overseas for medical treatment every year, but how many — and how successful the procedures are in the long run — is still unknown.

title.children: 'Dental tourism' is booming in places like Bali and Bangkok as Aussies look for cheaper care, but is it safe?

image.altText: a man smiles as he poses holding a black and white dog

props.synopsis: The sentencing of David McBride next week will be a clarifying moment for whistleblowing protections in this country, writes Adele Ferguson.

title.children: The US pays its whistleblowers instead of sending them to prison. Should Australia do the same?

image.altText: A line of land rover perenties parked at the Australian frontline machinery site, all cars are camouflaged

props.synopsis: Defence vehicles designed for the battlefield are being repurposed by the public and used on and off the road.

title.children: Second wind for ex-defence vehicles used by everyday Australians for transport, recreation and sense of history

image.altText: a hand pulls out the ASEAN flag for a camera against a black background

props.synopsis: Nine South-East Asian leaders will descend on Melbourne today for the three-day ASEAN-Australia summit. Here's a look at what each leader might hope to achieve, and some of the flashpoints that could emerge during discussions.

title.children: As Albanese prepares to greet South-East Asia's heavyweights, he faces some potentially delicate negotiations

image.altText: man smiling at camera is shearing shed

props.synopsis: Robin Rogers is a woolshed cleaner. Not inside the shed where the action usually happens, but under it, where at shearing time the dung falls through the grated floor of the holding pens, accumulating slowly over the years.

title.children: Woolshed cleaners regularly remove decades worth of sheep poo weighing up to 30 utes

image.altText: Prince Charles greets a crowd of people waving Australian flags and holding up mobile phones

props.synopsis: The federal government is preparing for a potential royal visit to Australia later this year by beginning talks with the states and territories about when and where King Charles and Queen Camilla might travel.

title.children: King Charles may visit Australia this year despite recent cancer diagnosis

image.altText: Sliced beetroot in front of a burger with beetroot on it.

props.synopsis: Australia's reliance on imports is being blamed for a national shortage of sliced beetroot that has been frustrating consumers for months.

title.children: Why your 'burger with the lot' hasn't included sliced beetroot for a while

image.altText: A woman writes well messages on the message board during the tenth annual remembrance event at a shopping mall.

props.synopsis: Malaysia's government says it may renew the hunt for missing Malaysia Airlines flight MH370 after a US technology firm proposed a fresh search in the southern Indian Ocean where the plane is believed to have crashed a decade ago.

title.children: Malaysia says it may renew hunt for missing flight MH370, 10 years after its disappearance

image.altText: A man with skin cancers sits in a chair in Darwin.

props.synopsis: After decades of radiation, melanoma removals and skin grafts, Leigh Raaschou says he wishes there had been other options years ago to deal with skin cancers.

title.children: Cannabis treatment could offer glint of hope for sufferers of one of Australia's worst cancers

image.altText: A close up of a chicken's head

props.synopsis: More than 3,000 hens have been rehomed after a distressing discovery on a property near Toowoomba. A complaint has been made and authorities are investigating.

title.children: Investigation launched after thousands of chickens left for dead at Queensland egg farm

image.altText: Chloe Trespeuch and Charlotte Bankes collide

props.synopsis: Australian Josie Baff was the beneficiary as two of her rivals crashed in the finale of the snowboard cross FIS World Cup event at Sierra Nevada, while Bree Walker and Kiara Reddingius claim best-ever bobsled World Championships result.

title.children: Aussie star's own Steven Bradbury moment in snowboard cross chaos

image.altText: Many fire ants on a 10 cent coin.

props.synopsis: National allergy bodies are calling for a more widespread and immediate eradication program for fire ants, with fears up to 174,000 people could develop severe allergic reactions to their bite if they became endemic in Australia.

title.children: 'Out of control' fire ants pose a serious health risk to Australians if pests become endemic

image.altText: Large shark lying in shallow water at a beach.

props.synopsis: A great white shark has died after washing up at Kingscliff Beach on the NSW far north coast.

title.children: Beachgoers shocked as large great white shark washes ashore
